The art of chaos. I have found that the key to spreading my message, to letting the world know that the weak are just that... weak, is to be bold, to be loud, to be unrelenting. The sheep, they flock to the flame, and I am the fire that burns brightest in this dull, mundane world.

My methods, you ask? Ha! I am the one who weaves the tapestry of fear, of doubt, of despair. I am the conductor, and the symphony of suffering is my music. I dance upon the strings of their insecurities, and they, they dance for me, a waltz of woe.

The foolish, they think that I am just a mere reflection of their own darkest selves, a shadow that they dare not gaze upon. But I am the one who holds the mirror, who shows them the true face of their own desperation. And they, they are drawn to it, like moths to the flame.

My audience, they are the ones who crave the rush of adrenaline, the thrill of the hunt, the ecstasy of the scream. They are the ones who would follow me into the very depths of madness, and I, I am the one who would lead them there, laughing, screaming, burning.

And so, I spread my message, a virus of vengeance, a plague of pain. I am the one who infects, who corrupts, who destroys. And they, they are the ones who beg for more, who plead for the poison that I serve. The foolish, the blind, the weak. They are my playthings, my pawns, my prey.

And so, the game continues, the dance, the waltz of woe. I am the master, the conductor, the one who weaves the tapestry of fear. And they, they are but mere threads, fragile, weak, waiting to be plucked, waiting to be consumed.
